results.title: Auguste and Louis Lumière
results.brief_description: In 1895 Auguste and Louis Lumière patented the Cinématographe, which could record, develop and project film. The Lumière brothers’ all-in-one device was lightweight, portable and operated by hand crank instead of electricity, but its biggest achievement was projection.

constellations_primary.name: The Lumière brothers
constellations_primary.description: The Lumière brothers understood the potential of cinema to be exhibited theatrically. Only one person could watch films through Thomas Edison's Kinetograph, while Auguste and Louis exhibited their films to thousands with Cinematographe.

results.description:
After learning about Thomas Edison’s Kinetograph in the early 1890s, Auguste and Louis Lumière set out to free motion pictures from Edison’s bulky contraption. In 1895 they succeeded, patenting the Cinématographe, which could record, develop and project film. The Lumière brothers’ all-in-one device was lightweight, portable and operated by hand crank instead of electricity. But its biggest achievement was projection: while only one person could look through the Kinetograph’s peephole at a time, audiences could watch Cinématographe films together.

Alongside their invention, the Lumière brothers premiered 10 short films on daily life, known as actualités, including the famous Arrival of a Train at La Ciotat (1896). The Cinématographe even inspired the new art form’s name: cinema.
description_for_label:
After learning about Thomas Edison’s Kinetograph in the early 1890s, Auguste and Louis Lumière set out to free motion pictures from Edison’s bulky contraption. In 1895 they succeeded, patenting the Cinématographe, which could record, develop and project film. The Lumière brothers’ all-in-one device was lightweight, portable and operated by hand crank instead of electricity. But its biggest achievement was projection: while only one person could look through the Kinetograph’s peephole at a time, audiences could watch Cinématographe films together.

Alongside their invention, the Lumière brothers premiered 10 short films on daily life, known as actualités, including the famous Arrival of a Train at La Ciotat (1896). The Cinématographe even inspired the new art form’s name: cinema.

results.title: Augusta
results.creator_credit: Anne Wheeler, Peter Jones, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film is the portrait of Augusta Evans, an 88-year-old Indian woman (the daughter of a Shuswap chief), who lives alone in a log cabin without running water or electricity. She recalls past times, but lives very much in the present. Self-sufficient, dedicated to her people, she spreads warmth wherever she moves with her songs, her harmonica and her soft-voiced comments. Award: San Francisco.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Wheeler, Peter Jones, John Taylor and ONF | NFB

results.title: Audition (D)
results.creator_credit: Miike Takashi, Akemi Suyama and Omega Project
results.brief_description: Seven years after the death of his wife, Aoyama (Ryo Ishibashi) holds auditions for actresses in a film that is not going to be made as a means to find a suitable partner for him to marry. Through this process he meets and is entranced with Asami (Eihi Shiina), a striking woman with ballet training. After deciding to propose, Aoyama is prompted by his friend to check into the background of his intended and is alarmed to find that not only has Asami has lied about her job, but also about where she lives. Asami lives alone - except for the writhing victim she keeps tied up in a sack on the floor, minus his tongue, feet and half his fingers. Takashi’s fifth film is a tense and disturbing thriller, full of macabre surprises which, if known, would spoil some truly terrifying and sadistic actions of an emotionally scarred woman hell bent on vengeance. WARNING: The violence in “Audition” is an examination of the limits and bounds of sadism and revenge and is highly confronting and disturbing. In Japanese with English subtitles.

Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.

results.title: Audience contact
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This program in the ‘Speaking with confidence’ series covers the areas of eye contact, gesture, use of notes and lectern, as well as body movement. A sheet providing summary notes, suggested exercises, as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

results.title: Audacious [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Fiona Tuomy and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A sexually repressed but inquisitive wife stumbles across an interactive pornographic computer program when she borrows her workmates computer. The program is AUDACIOUS; a husband and wife team who invites you to share your fantasies. She submits her fantasies, and becomes addicted to watching them being enacted on the videos they create. Her husband discovers the videos, leading them to question the relevance fantasy has to their marriage. Sometimes simple fantasies are the most telling. Cast includes Dee Smart, John Polson and Aden Young.

results.title: Aucassin and Nicolette
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Guy Glover and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An animated medieval fantasy, a delightful silhouette film, with colour background by master German animator Lotte Reiniger. Set against a background of castles and forest with Renaissance style music this enchanting tale recounts the love story of Aucassin and Nicolette.
